instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_TPAD_CONN</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi all!

Have this board with a not working trackpad

After inspecting the board i saw that L4800 is melted - no courant that goes to trackpad. It also damaged the tracks under it as well as it have damaged 4830 but not sure if the damage is purely cosmetic or if i will have to find this one some where. 

My question is: is L4800 mandatory or it can be bypassed? Any idea what could cause that? The board look clean and the trackpad as well, but i see that some one already played with the screws of track pad... not sure if the one installed is the original or a replacement.


Thank you!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_TPAD_CONN</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
L4800 can be bypassed with tiny wire.
First be SURE, no short on J4801 side (<CAPACITOR>C4800</CAPACITOR> pads), w/ and w/o trackpad connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_TPAD_CONN</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
[USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] thank you! Great!
There is no short how ever i need <CHIP>U4830</CHIP> as well.. it felt apart as soon as i touch it... cant find it online :/ do you know where it could be found?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_TPAD_CONN</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Update:
I guess i found it, is it the right part? [URL]https://www.digikey.ca/en/products/detail/nexperia-usa-inc/74LVC1G08GF-132/1300833?s=N4IgTCBcDaIOwBYA2A3AxgRgOYAYAcWAZgDQYDMEAugL5A[/URL]

I also find 74lvc1g08[B]fz4  [/B]from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.. is it interchangeable?

Thank you!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_TPAD_CONN</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
74LVC1G08 is the base code you need to search for, in SOT891 case.
It can be found in many older MacBook boards.
Just do a search in pdf schematics of your scrap boards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_TPAD_CONN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Yes, exactly how i was searching for it but i onpy have 3 board and its newer board (2018+) witch does not have this chip.. anyways, ordered online, hopefully will be here soon
